etymologies: Old English hāre hūne, from hār (see hoar) + hūne, the name of the white horehound, also applied to related plants

definitions: a strong-smelling hairy plant of the mint family, with a tradition of use in medicine.

notes.text: Two species in the family Labiatae: white horehound (Marrubium vulgare), a widely distributed plant traditionally used as a medicinal herb, and black horehound (Ballota nigra), a Eurasian plant that has become naturalized in North America and was formerly reputed to cure the bite of a mad dog

shortDefinitions: strong-smelling hairy plant of mint family, with tradition of use in medicine

definitions: the bitter aromatic juice of white horehound, used especially in the treatment of coughs and colds.
shortDefinitions: bitter aromatic juice of white horehound
